notesStmt.note: Dirt. Oily patches. Large infills at inner end, lost adhesion. Severe cockling and pleats obscuring text. Ink flaking. Carbon ink granular, with losses from damp. Water-damaged (ink offset to verso from damp). Small rectangular excisions.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

collation.p: 28 membranes, with wooden roller (135mm) and leader (817mm).

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Ashkenazi square script of the 17th century.

history.provenance: Acquisition: Bequeathed to the British Museum by Rev. J. Noble Coleman on 25 May 1872: inscribed on verso.
